page.title: 01Local History
page.content: The Ancient Royal Burgh of Craill is a delightful town in the far east corner of Fife. It nestles round a sheltered harbour on the north coast of the Firth of Forth,open to the winds of the south and east. Most important pursuits are farming and fishing for crabs and lobster. Many older people retire here some brought as children for holidays and have happy memories of playing on the beaches and scrambling over the rocks. New houses have been built and more are expected. Tourism is very important to the area with three caravan sites and several hotels. The local people are jealous of their inheritance. Much is done to protect the old style of architecture.
